de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.jcore.rest

Class RestInterfaceTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.glassfish.jersey.test.JerseyTest
      • de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.AbstractTest
        • de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.jcore.rest.RestInterfaceTest

  • public class RestInterfaceTest
extends AbstractTest
    This Class extends the AbstractTest to test the RestInterface of the JEngine core. In order to do so it uses the functionality of the JerseyTest There are test methods for every possible REST Call. In order to stay independent from existing tests, the database will be set up before and after the execution. Define the database Properties inside the database_connection file.

      void setUpBase() 
      void terminateScenarioInstance()
      When you send a Post to RestInterface.terminateScenarioInstance(int, int) with an valid scenario instance id the scenario should be terminated and the response is a 201.
      void terminateScenarioInstanceInvalidId()
      When you send a Post to RestInterface.terminateScenarioInstance(int, int) with an invalid instance id then the Response should be a 404 with an error message.
      void testGetActivitiesCorrect()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getActivitiesOfInstance(UriInfo, int, int, String, String) with correct instance and scenario a 200 with json content will be returned.
      void testGetActivitiesInvalidInstance()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getActivitiesOfInstance(UriInfo, int, int, String, String) with an wrong scenario instance ID then a 404 with error message (inside JSON) should be returned.
      void testGetActivitiesRedirects()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getActivitiesOfInstance(UriInfo, int, int, String, String) with an wrong scenario ID the request should be redirected to the correct one.
      void testGetActivitiesWithFilter()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getActivitiesOfInstance(UriInfo, int, int, String, String) with a filter String then only activities with a label like the filter String will be returned.
      void testGetActivitiesWithInvalidState()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getActivitiesOfInstance(UriInfo, int, int, String, String) with an correct parameters, an invalid state but no filter the request should return a 404 with error message
      void testGetActivitiesWithInvalidStateFilter()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getActivitiesOfInstance(UriInfo, int, int, String, String) with an correct parameters, an invalid state but no filter the request should return a 404 with error message
      void testGetActivitiesWithState()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getActivitiesOfInstance(UriInfo, int, int, String, String) with an correct parameters a state but no filter then the request should return all activities with this state.
      void testGetActivitiesWithStateAndFilter()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getActivitiesOfInstance(UriInfo, int, int, String, String) with an correct parameters a state and a filter then the request should return all activities with the state who fulfill the filter condition.
      void testGetActivitiesWithStateTerminated()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getActivitiesOfInstance(UriInfo, int, int, String, String) with an correct parameters a state but no filter then the request should return all activities with this state.
      void testGetActivity()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getActivity(UriInfo, int, int, int) with valid arguments then you should get a 200 response code and a JSONObject with the id, label of the activity and a link to the outputSet and the inputSet.
      void testGetDataObject()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getDataObject(int, int, int) with correct instance, scenario and dataobject id you will get a 200 with an json object.
      void testGetDataObjectInvalidDoId()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getDataObject(int, int, int) with correct instance and scenario id but a wrong dataobject id you will get a 404 with an error message.
      void testGetDataObjectInvalidInstanceId()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getDataObject(int, int, int) with correct scenario id but an incorrect instance id you will get a 404 with an error message
      void testGetDataObjectRedirects()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getDataObject(int, int, int) with a correct scenario instance id but a wrong scenario id you will be redirected
      void testGetDataObjectsInvalid()
      WHen you send a Get to RestInterface.getDataObjects(UriInfo, int, int, String) with an invalid instance an 404 with error message will be returned
      void testGetDataObjectsRedirects()
      WHen you send a Get to RestInterface.getDataObjects(UriInfo, int, int, String) with a correct instance id and a wrong scenario ID you will be redirected automatically.
      void testGetDataObjectsWithFilter()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getDataObjects(UriInfo, int, int, String) with an valid instance and scenario and an filter String you will get a list of all DataObjects with labels like the filter String for this scenario.
      void testGetDataObjectsWOFilter()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getDataObjects(UriInfo, int, int, String) with an valid instance and scenario and no filter String you will get a list of all DataObjects for this scenario.
      void testGetInputDataObjects()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getInputDataObjects(UriInfo, int, int, int) with valid arguments then you then you should get a 200 response code and a JSONObject with the id of the inputSet and a link to get the dataObjectInstance with their dataAttributeInstance.
      void testGetInputForInvalidActivity()
      Given: Is an invalid activity instance when you send a get to RestInterface.getInputDataObjects(UriInfo, int, int, int) with an invalid activity instance id a 404 with an error message is returned
      void testGetInputForInvalidScenario()
      Given: Is an invalid scenario instance when you send a get to RestInterface.getInputDataObjects(UriInfo, int, int, int) with an invalid scenario and instance id a 404 with an error message is returned
      void testGetInputForWOInputSets()
      Given: Is an valid activity instance when you send a get to RestInterface.getInputDataObjects(UriInfo, int, int, int) with a valid activity instance without input sets a 404 with an error message will be returned
      void testGetInputSetDataAttributes()
      when you send a get to RestInterface.getInputDataObjectsAndAttributes(int, int, int) with valid arguments a 200 is returned with a JSONArray with JSONObjects for each dataObjectInstance
      void testGetOutputDataObjects()
      When you send a Get to RestInterface.getOutputDataObjects(UriInfo, int, int, int) with valid arguments then you then you should get a 200 response code and a JSONObject with the id of the outputSet and a link to get the dataObjectInstance with their dataAttributeInstance.
      void testGetOutputForInvalidScenario()
      Given: Is an invalid scenario instance when you send a get to RestInterface.getOutputDataObjects(UriInfo, int, int, int) with an invalid scenario and instance id a 404 with an error message is returned
      void testGetOutputForWOOutputSets()

      void testGetScenarioContentWithFilter()
      When you sent a GET to RestInterface.getScenarios(UriInfo, String) and you use a Filter then the returned JSON will contain the latest version of all Scenarios with a name containing the filterString.

        public void testGetScenarioInstancesReturnsCorrectJson()
        When you send a Get to RestInterface.getScenarioInstances(UriInfo, int, String) with a valid scenario id then a json object with all instances, id and label should be returned. The schema should be: {"ids": [1,2..], "names":{1: "abc" ...}}

        when you send a get to RestInterface.getInputDataObjectsAndAttributes(int, int, int) with an invalid scenario/Instance a 404 with an error message is returned

        public void testInvalidInputSetGetInputSetDataAttributes()
